intro: [WRONG START] Hieracesium carpathicola, commonly known as the Carpathian hawkweed, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Carpathian Mountains. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and medicinal properties. The plant typically grows in rocky or alpine habitats, thriving in well-drained soils. It features basal leaves that are often hairy and lance-shaped, with a height ranging from 10 to 30 centimeters. Hieracium carpathicola is noted for its yellow flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer.
